description._content: Collection: NASA Solarsystem Collection Title: Earth From Mars Description: This is the first image ever taken of Earth from the surface of a planet beyond the Moon. It was taken by the Mars Exploration Rover Spirit one hour before sunrise on the 63rd Martian day, or sol, of its mission. The image is a mosaic of images taken by the rover's navigation camera showing a broad view of the sky, and an image taken by the rover's panoramic camera of Earth. The contrast in the panoramic camera image was increased two times to make Earth easier to see.The inset shows a combination of four panoramic camera images zoomed in on Earth. The arrow points to Earth. Earth was too faint to be detected in images taken with the panoramic camera's color filters. *Image Credit*: NASA/JPL/Cornell/Tex as A&M Date: 03.08.2004 UID: SPD-SLRSY-1483 Original url: solarsystem.nasa.gov/multimedia/display.cfm?IM_ID=1483 SOURCE: nasaimages.org/luna/servlet/detail/nasaNAS~20~20~120285~2... Visit www.nasaimages.org for the most comprehensive compilation of NASA stills, film and video, created in partnership with Internet Archive.
